result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley B. Davies was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 52 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: Shall undergot drug treatment as requested by agent
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

14CF253 & 254 - Defendant Harley B. Davies in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
